Props.Text: $$SERVER$:$WELCOME_TO_SERVER
$$SERVER$:$SERVER_SLOGAN
Q: What page is this showing on?
A: Just a demo server info page provided my the Ark-Nucleus mod.
This is just a small representation of what kind of pages can be setup using the Ark-Nucleus JSON Editor.
Q: Can I disable this for my server?
A: Yes, Go to Installed Mods -> Ark Nucleus ->Server Settings
As majority of things is optional in Ark-Nucleus so is the Server Info Page. You don't see use for it? Disable it!
Q: Who can edit this page?
A: Only Admins can edit this page.
If you are in the admin mode, you will see an EDIT button in the upper right corner.
Death-Valley FAQ!!!
Death-Valley Lore FAQ
Q: WHAT IS DEATH‑VALLEY?

A: Death‑Valley began like any other Ark — a shard of a broken world drifting in the void, a place to survive, to build, to hope. But for those who found it, it became something more. When life outside offered no home, the Valley became one. A refuge. A promise. A world worth fighting for.
Q: WHAT WAS THE AGE OF BUILDING

A: Beneath a sky of crystal light, We rose from nothing and claimed the night. Stone to iron, beasts to friends — Our tribes built homes the stars would defend. The First Builders walked among our lands, Teaching the ways with steady hands. For 9 long years the Arks would thrive, Under the watch of the Wildcards’ eye.
Q: THE SHADOW NAMED SNAILGAMES

A: But whispers crossed the distant seas, A name carried on a windswept breeze. SnailGames — the campfires cursed — A shadow that brought the dark clouds first. Their word was law, their hearts were cold, The fate of the Arks in their hands to hold. No council heard, no pleas could stay The night they chose to take it away.
Q: THE GREAT FALL

A: On the thirtieth day of the ninth year’s end, The sky grew silent, with no light to send. The towers dimmed, the beasts cried out, As tribes fell silent, their flames burned out. Worlds we built with love and pain Were gone in an instant — nothing remained.
Q: THE FIRST BUILDERS STAND

A: The First Builders wept beside our tribes; They fought with words, they fought with time. But SnailGames held the final key And cast the worlds into the sea. The gates were closed, the Arks would die, Our homes turned dust beneath the sky.
Q: THE CRYSTAL MEMORIES
A: We gathered the shards of what had been — The crystal memories of the worlds we’d seen. We carried them into the Ascended dawn, Though the heart of the old worlds was forever gone.
Q: THE VOW OF THE SURVIVORS

A: On the thirtieth day of the ninth year’s end, The tribes remember — the scars won’t mend. SnailGames took the worlds we knew, But the tribes will rise; we’ll start anew. For every beast, for every friend, We’ll build again — until the very end.
Q: How do I contact the server admins?
A: If you need assistance or have any concerns, you can reach out to our server admins via Discord. They are here to help resolve any issues and ensure everyone has an enjoyable gaming experience.
We hope this FAQ helps address any questions you may have about our Ark game server. If you have any further inquiries, don't hesitate to ask our friendly community or server staff. Happy gaming!
Rules For Death-Valley
The listed Ruels and Guids are just some of the rules listed in discord
1. Respect thy Neighbor: Treat your fellow Survivors with courtesy and respect. No harassment, hate speech, or toxic behavior will be tolerated.
2. PvP: PvP is welcomed, but raids are sacred battles, No base may be raided without the opponent’s consent in Discord, A raid is a clash of warriors — never a one‑sided siege.

3. Cheating and Exploits: Respect is the law of the realm. All who walk these lands must treat one another with honor, Harassment, hate speech, and toxic conduct are forbidden and will be purged without mercy. We're here for fair play and a fun experience for everyone.

4. Let your structures rise with purpose: not greed. In the realm of Death-Valley, the land itself is sacred. Overgrown fortresses, reckless sprawl, and pillar corruption are forbidden, for they choke the world and weaken the flow of its power. Build with intention, and the realm will honor you.
5. Fair Play Edict: Creatures under taming are sacred. No member may harm or slay a beast in the midst of bonding. Honor the ritual or face the consequences.
6. Roleplay Encouraged: Engage in immersive roleplay if that's your style! Whether you're a lone survivor, a tribal leader, or a dino tamer, bring your character to life.
7. Community Events: Join in on server-wide events for a chance to earn rewards, make new friends, and test your skills against the challenges we throw your way.

8. Let it be known: Those who twist the world through cheats, exploits, or forbidden tools break the sacred balance. Such actions will be met with immediate judgment. This realm thrives on fair combat and true challenge.
Death‑Valley Reborn — Memory and Resolve
These pieces tell the history of Death‑Valley — its rise, its fall, the names we remember, and the vow we keep.

The Age of Building
Beneath the sky of crystal light,
We rose from nothing, we claimed the night.
Stone to iron, beasts to friends,
Our tribes had homes the stars would defend.
The First Builders walked among our lands,
Teaching the ways with guiding hands.
Ten long years, the Arks would thrive,
Under the watch of the Obelisks’ eye.

The Shadow Named SnailGames
But whispers came across the seas,
A name was spoken on the windswept breeze.
SnailGames… the campfires cursed,
A name that brought the dark clouds first.
Their word was law, their hearts were cold,
The fate of the Arks in their hands to hold.
No council heard, no pleas could stay,
The night they chose to take it away.

The Great Fall
On the thirtieth day of the ninth year’s end,
The sky grew silent, no light to send.
The towers dimmed, the beasts cried out,
As tribes fell silent, their flames burned out.
Worlds we built with love and pain,
Gone in an instant, nothing remained.

The First Builders Stand
The First Builders wept beside our tribes,
They fought with words, they fought with time.
But SnailGames held the final key,
And cast the worlds into the sea.
The gates were closed, the Arks would die,
Our homes now dust beneath the sky.

The Crystal Memories
We gathered the shards of what had been,
The Crystal Memories of the worlds we’d seen.
Carried them into the Ascended dawn,
But the heart of the old worlds was forever gone.

The Vow of the Survivors
On the thirtieth day of the ninth year’s end,
The tribes remember, the scars won’t mend.
SnailGames took the worlds we knew,
But the tribes will rise, we’ll start anew.
For every beast, for every friend,
We’ll build again, till the very end.
A Personal Lament and Promise

Five years ago, no map, no star,
Camper walls, life felt far.
A friend said, “Come, I’ll show you a land,”
Where dinos roam and dreams can stand.
I built with my partner, my friends by my side,
Death Valley rose, our kingdom, our pride.

Death Valley, you carried me through,
When the nights were cold, I still had you.
Stone by stone, beast by beast,
In your arms, my soul found peace.

Then came the fall, the sky turned black,
Snail Games struck, no turning back.
Like a thousand arrows raining down,
Our world was gone, burned to the ground.
But ASA’s light broke through the shade,
We swore to rebuild, a new home made.

Richard Arrives
Then Richard came, almost blind,
But saw more than most could find.
Seventy-five inches of screen lit his way,
Learning to fight, to build, to stay.
Through traps, through beasts, he never quit,
Every wall he placed had love in it.
He showed us home was more than land,
It’s the people who build it, hand in hand.

The Last Log Out 
One night he logged out, 2:55,
Coffee on the table, but not alive.
His eighth stroke took him from our side,
And Death Valley went quiet inside.

We saved the world he helped create,
But I drifted, lost in grief’s weight.
Then Raasclark’s voice, and Isa’s call,
Dragon’s tribe — they gave me it all.
We fought bosses, we claimed the land,
Together we stood, hand in hand.

Death Valley, you carried me through,
When I thought I was lost, I still had you.
Richard’s dream still burns in the skies,
Every sunrise in ARK is his eyes.
I searched the world for where I belong,
It was here with my tribe all along.

Home isn’t stone, it’s the love you find,
The ones who stay, the ties that bind.
Death Valley lives — in every song,
My home, my heart, all along.
Community Links
If you want this page shortened, split into separate tabs, or further edited, tell me and I will generate the exact replacement block.

Props.Title: Web Url Widget
Props.Note: The Url Widget makes it easy to host the JSON widget somewhere on the web and reuse it on multiple server or edit it without the need to joining the game.
